item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, May 20, 2025 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Deep Learning Is Applied Topology (136 points | 81 comments)
2. If an AI agent can't figure out how your API works, neither can your users (79 points | 31 comments)
3. Show HN: 90s.dev - game maker that runs on the web (72 points | 31 comments)
4. Show HN: A Tiling Window Manager for Windows, Written in Janet (47 points | 13 comments)
5. The Fractured Entangled Representation Hypothesis (11 points | 1 comment)
6. 27000 Dragons and 10'000 Lights: GPU-Driven Clustered Forward Renderer (11 points | 1 comment)
7. Show HN: Astra – a new js2exe compiler (27 points | 8 comments)
8. The emoji problem (2022) (221 points | 29 comments)
9. Launch HN: Opusense (YC X25) – AI assistant for construction inspectors on site (10 points | 1 comment)
10. The Lisp in the Cellar: Dependent types that live upstairs [pdf] (42 points | 6 comments)
11. A simple search engine from scratch (168 points | 23 comments)
12. llm-d, Kubernetes native distributed inference (60 points | 9 comments)
13. Making Video Games (Without an Engine) in 2025 (369 points | 158 comments)
14. OpenAI Codex Review (22 points | 8 comments)
15. Compiling OCaml to the TI-84 CE Calculator (54 points | 2 comments)
16. DDoSecrets publishes 410 GB of heap dumps, hacked from TeleMessage (575 points | 156 comments)
17. Have I Been Pwned 2.0 (747 points | 250 comments)
18. Production tests: a guidebook for better systems and more sleep (5 points | discuss)
19. Show HN: Text to 3D simulation on a map (does history pretty well) (32 points | 31 comments)
20. Jules: An Asynchronous Coding Agent (448 points | 182 comments)
21. Hypervisor as a Library (5 points | discuss)
22. Show HN: JavaFactory – IntelliJ plugin to generate Java code (27 points | 8 comments)
23. Finland announces migration of its rail network to international gauge (356 points | 323 comments)
24. RepoRoulette: Randomly sample repositories from GitHub (14 points | 2 comments)
25. The Windows Subsystem for Linux is now open source (1481 points | 1020 comments)
26. What are people doing? Live-ish estimates based on global population dynamics (237 points | 83 comments)
27. Why Does the U.S. Always Run a Trade Deficit? (132 points | 246 comments)
28. I got fooled by AI-for-science hype–here's what it taught me (277 points | 213 comments)
29. Claude Code SDK (420 points | 185 comments)
30. Microsoft-backed Builder.ai enters insolvency proceedings (8 points | discuss)
